comments.body: Nit: no curly braces for single-line `if` statements throughout this file.
Why was the change in how we load the schema necessary?

I couldn't find a way for the previous version to load the path from `MemoryFileSystem` on tests that used it. I believe it should work in production, but I wouldn't have a way to verify the windows behavior. 

If I remember correctly this was the line that caused problems `return new File(uri.scheme == 'file' ? uri.toFilePath() : schemaUrl)`, from `Schema.createSchemaFromUrl`. 

I did a lot of refactors from the 1st working version to the present cleaned one, but couldn't figure out a way to make `Schema.createSchemaFromUrl` work without changing it.
BTW the tests I added on `flutter_manifest_test.dart` deal directly with this change.

Ah, I see now.  Yeah, it's pretty tricky -- you have to use `IOOverrides` when you want to inject your `MemoryFileSystem` into a package that doesn't use `package:file`.

Check out the following sample for how to do this in a test:

https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/f9bb4289e9fd861d70ae78bcc3a042ef1b35cc9d/packages/flutter_test/test/goldens_test.dart#L37-L57

With something like that, you should be able to keep the old call to `Schema.createSchemaFromUrl`, which should yield better asynchrony.

here's another variation on `createSchemaFromUrl` that apparently would make it work: 
`final Uri uri = Uri.parse(r'$schemaUrl');`.

This whole effort is going beyond my reasonable energy.
Maybe extract this pattern to a facility like `castStringKeyedMap`. We could let that method return an empty map on `null` input (but then we might also want to rename it `toStringKeyedMap`).
This is doing a lot of work for a getter, and repeating it every time. Maybe pull the computation out to a helper function, and cache the result.
does not print asset's url, hard to find which asset was null or empty
Didn't know you could have both `final` and a type in a for loop.
These can't be factory constructors since they can return null, and this is disallowed post NNBD
